question: With the development of social media, more and more youngsters are being allowed unsupervised access to the internet in order to meet and chat with friends which can lead to potentially dangerous situations. What solutions can you suggest to deal with this problem?
text: The rise of online social networking sites has been one of the most significant media developments in recent years. The ubiquity of these communication tools has prompted youngsters to devote considerable time to online chatting without supervision, which could be associated with several detrimental impacts. This essay will discuss the reckless uses of social media, and also propose several appropriate solutions to address the issue.

Social networking sites enable people to strike new friendships whereas false identities are forged for abuse. A typical case is that some dreadful users groom youngsters to meet them fact to face, and may eventually sexually assault them. The solution to the problem has to be devised in light of the issues. First and foremost, guardians and supervisors play a vital role in urging youngsters to establish online companionship with absolute circumspection. Keeping abreast of the news on social media misdeeds provides a glimpse of the criminal methods used for crimes so that and youngsters would then less likely to take the baits.

In addition, online forums for peer discussion could result in exposure to adverse influence and become a cyberbully. Malicious comments and scurrilous materials inflict a great deal of distress on the victims, and even contribute to the increasing number of suicides. No one desires to be subjected to continual vicious harassment. For this reason, it is paramount in education for the users to realize the aftermath of discriminating against others with anonymity. Furthermore, governments could implement effective measures and policies to combat cyberbullying.

To recapitulate, unsupervised access to social networking sites are attributed to the rise of despicable cyber crimes.cybercrimes. Despite the fact that the regular use of social networks could not be eliminated, there are means that could ameliorate interrelated problems. improper use of the Internet.
